thread.section_title: AP Top Travel News At 10:16 a.m. EDT
thread.title: 2 DC-area airports hosting jazz performances

title: 2 DC-area airports hosting jazz performances
text: Yesterday's Places WASHINGTON (AP) -- Two airports in the Washington area are hosting a series of jazz performances. The performances at Washington Dulles International Airport and Ronald Reagan Washington National Airport begin Thursday and continue mostly on Thursdays through Aug. 13. The airports say there will be Caribbean, contemporary, classical and R&B jazz. This is the fifth year of the Summer Jazz Series. Three performances are planned at Dulles. The first is Thursday followed by performances on July 30 and Aug. 13. Four performances at Reagan are planned: July 23 and 31 and Aug. 6 and 13. At Dulles, the performances will be held near the east security checkpoint on the ticketing level. At Reagan, the performances will be held in pre-security areas near Terminal B and C.
